In this paragraph, the "Property Value" entities refer to specific terms related to the experiment or process being discussed. These entities include the material being tested (PzNDTDTBT), a measured property of the material (measured PCE), a process applied to the material (thermal annealing), and a change in the material's property values (a slight decrease of photovoltaic values).

After reviewing the paragraph, I have determined that only two entities clearly refer to the values of material properties. These entities are "measured PCE" and "a slight decrease of photovoltaic values." The other entities, "PzNDTDTBT" and "thermal annealing," are either the name of the material being tested or a process applied to the material, respectively, and do not directly refer to the values of material properties.
